C++ Argument Capturing
[C++ Sensor Placement]

These should only be used within any of DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE, DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE. More...

Defines

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE   __DYNATRACE_QUALIFIED__ Capture(__dynatrace_serial_no__)
 Creates a Capture instance that you can stream arguments onto.

Detailed Description

These should only be used within any of DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE, DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE. 

void Foo::bar(int i, const char *cp, double d, boolean b) {
    DYNATRACE_AUTO_PUREPATH_CAPTURE(DYNATRACE_CAPTURE << i << cp << d << b);
    ...
}

int Foo::add(int a, int b) {
    DYNATRACE_AUTO_NODE_CAPTURE(DYNATRACE_CAPTURE << a << b);
    DYNATRACE_RETURN_INT32(a+b);
}

Define Documentation

#define DYNATRACE_CAPTURE   __DYNATRACE_QUALIFIED__ Capture(__dynatrace_serial_no__)

Creates a Capture instance that you can stream arguments onto.

See also:
Argument Capturing for supported types.
Returns:
an instance of Capture
